Soil Drainage: ["Poorly drained","Somewhat poorly drained","Moderately well drained","Well drained"]
Notes: Termination [Goal: Method: Timing: If using herbicides to terminate use a tank mixture (e.g., glyphosate + dicamba or 2,4-d); do not rely on glyphosate alone.
Notes: Growth, Roots, and Nutrients: Root is both tap and fibrous. Minimum Germination Temp. 41˚F   Medium Red Clover seed is a small seed, for successful Red Clover establishment the soil should be firm (packed). Being a small seed, it should not be planted too deep, only up to ¼ inch deep. Most establishment problems have resulted from planting the seed to deep. In mixes, include this in the small box of the drill or adjust the drill accordingly that the seed is not placed too deep.
Notes: Manage for bloat when grazing. When the crop is stressed it can produce phytoestrogens, so do not graze breeding/pregnant sheep on red clover.
